title: Property Manager - great company to learn from

cons: None. They really are exceptional

title: I like Cousins!
pros: The culture is great - the people who work at Cousins are so supportive and want to invest in your career and see you succeed.
cons: Pay and benefits could be better!

title: Cousins is great!

pros: Very stable company. Leadership seems to care about everyone.

title: Lack of Communication
pros: Competitive salary, good accounting dept. and opportunities to volunteer

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Family oriented company. It didn't feel like you were just a number.
cons: Pay need to go up with the market.

title: Best Life Work Balance culture
pros: Very flexible with Employees, good benefits, good pay.
cons: I do not have any

title: Accounting
pros: environmental is very important and working for this company is a good fit for anyone in Accounting
cons: remote is only 1 day per week

title: Exciting company for anyone in finance and development but accounting positions were not so great.
pros: Its an exciting company to work for if you're involved on the finance or development side of things. They show great promise and continued growth. They totally dominate most of the markets that they are in.
cons: Located in Buckhead, where traffic is a nightmare but they're right on the buckhead marta station. The employee review process was broken. Your bonus was not based on how well you performed. It was tied directly to the company's overall performance, which actually wasn't the worst thing since the company had done well while I was there. But the issue was that your performance review literally did not matter. We had the ability to work from home but were rarely allowed. I don't know if this has changed since I've left. Most people on the accounting side were unhappy and starting to look for other jobs by the time I had left. Lots of people spent their entire careers at the company and were overlooked for senior positions, which were given to outside hires. This had a large effect on the employee morale for people in accounting.

title: Company and culture have changed - not in a positive way
pros: Nice buildings with free soda and coffee.
cons: For the past three years - the company has become very political and a very cold environment. Everyone from the CEO to HR has become harsh and it appears that they have forgotten what previously made them a good company- their people. Benefits cost are becoming a burden on employees, employees seem to be set-up and fired, their is a lack of employee voices being heard, employees are treated harshly and expected to work more than 10 hours per day and weekends.

title: Horrible Culture-Unprofessional, Back-stabbing, Not inclusive
pros: Nice properties and nice offices
cons: The worst upper management I've ever seen. They may be a great company in Atlanta but Austin is a nightmare. There is so much turnover, favoritism, back-stabbing, verbal abuse and an overall lack of consistency or standards. The culture is non-existent, no meaningful interaction within or between offices. Maintenance, Admin and Customer Service have suffered as a result of constant turnover, no traction possible. HR doesn't care or get involved to solve any issues. Don't damage your career or reputation by being associated with this company. The worst place I have ever worked. Don't believe the positive reviews, they must be written by upper management or HR. Note-No hybrid or work from home, 100% on site, outdated paradigm. Benefits are just ok, high deductible.

title: Disconnect between Atlanta and other locations
pros: Lots of opportunities to learn and take classes; fairly generous PTO schedule.
cons: HR and Accounting are absolutely AWFUL!! The benefits packages is a joke - they pay your monthly premiums if you do medical screenings but they only have High Deductible plans and the single person annual deductible is $3250!! This totally discourages people from going to the doctor and is the exact opposite of what they are trying to accomplish wit the "wellness" program. Atlanta is the HQ and they do an awful job of communicating with the other markets. Management seems to have it's head in the sand!

title: Building Engineer
pros: Good properties to work at. Mostly great people to work with. Very professional company with their $#!% together. Upper management relatively approachable. Notice hard work.
cons: Low pay for industry standard. They say its compensated by the benefits, which looses its luster after you hear that so often. Building Engineers are locked into very strict levels (ex. Level I, II, III). Management is too focused on keeping engineers in those boundaries.

title: If you have a brain keep moving
pros: Long standing established company. They have a few positive programs in place for engineering. They have a great legal department.
cons: The corporate office across the board is completely disconnected with employees. Other members of management stick their head in the sand and refuse to deal with issues. If you are a confident capable person, able to think on your own and outside the box, this company is not for you.

title: Great place to work
pros: This is an amazing company to work for. They truly stand behind their core values and it continues to lead the company to succeed and grow. Great benefits, pay, management is approachable and willing to listen. Management encourages growth and is willing to pay to advance careers. If you work hard for this company, no matter your title, it will be noticed.
cons: Sometimes the process to get things improved can be slow.

title: Great Vibe
pros: Focused on teambuilding and customer service. They invest thousands of dollars annually for employee training. Until 2019 we had free medical insurance.
cons: I have only worked for three other management companies. Cousins takes the time to get things right the first time.

title: Building engineer
pros: I learned so much in this industry it was by far the best job I ever had with the most amazing people to learn from it’s not an easy one but being the first female in the company they didn’t make me feel like I fell any short or different from any of the guys!
cons: There was no longer any room for me to grow.

title: HR Department was terrible
pros: The majority of the people are nice to work with and promote a good work environment.
cons: Their HR department was rude and never helpful in my experience. I complained about inappropriate behavior exhibited by my manager and it was never addressed by HR.

title: Excellent Company
pros: The company culture overall is extremely positive. Everyone from the President of the company, the CEO and other executives, down to the support staff, is very pleasant to work with. There is also opportunity for growth within many departments.
cons: It would be nice to have more companywide events/functions for employees.

title: Retail Property Management
pros: Excellent, well-maintained environment, friendly and knowledgeable co-workers. Flexible schedule at that particular property. Learned a lot about property management for office and retail space.
cons: Corporate office may not have known how much assistant level staff were involved in helping things run well.

title: "We're a family here"
pros: The engineering team is great to work with. Free coffee. snacks, and beverages. The GM is out of the office having lunch half the day every day, so there's very little micromanaging!
cons: Upper management is a nightmare. HR is useless. They treat you like (a dysfunctional) family. If you want to get paid peanuts and get beat to the ground, Cousins is for you.

title: Great company
pros: Thoroughly enjoy working with Cousins. The management is very involved in personal well-being and very flexible company.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: Great company
pros: Cousins Properties offered great opportunities for growth and an above average benefits package.
cons: I will miss the people but not the commute to downtown.
